descript.abstract: This parcel layer contains discrete, non-overlapping polygons for each property. Adjacent polygons with common ownership and a single tax record have been retained in the "OthLeg" layer that accompanies this TaxPar layer, and dissolved into single parcels in this TaxPar layer. Some non-adjacent parcels may be represented by multi-part polygons where they share common ownership and a single tax record. Public right of ways exist as polygons, not null space. Linework associated with private ROWs are retained in the "OthLeg" layer. Water polygons also representing parcel boundaries have been retained in this TaxPar layer. Additional water features that are not considered parcel boundaries may have been placed in the "Misc" layer that accompanies this TaxPar layer. Easements and other similar non-fee taxable boundaries exist in the 'OthLeg" layer, not the TaxPar layer. Data updated to include changes as of 01/01/2020.
descript.supplinf: Data prepared for MassGIS as part of a statewide digital parcel initative and meets Level III standards, v2.0, November 2010.

idinfo.accconst: This digital parcel data layer is considered to be in the public domain and will become accessible for download and display from the MassGIS website: http://www.mass.gov/mgis
idinfo.useconst: This data may be appropriate for planning purposes. It should not be utilized where legal and surveyed property boundaries are required.
idinfo.native: This parcel data is submitted to MassGIS in a file geodatabase. It will be incorporated into the MassGIS SDE database, and may be converted into other GIS data types for future distribution.
idinfo.datacred: Updates by Central Massachusetts Regional Planning Commission. Original conversion by James W. Sewall Company

dataqual.logic: This parcel layer contains discrete, non-overlapping polygons for each property. Adjacent polygons with common ownership and a single tax record have been retained in the "OthLeg" layer that accompanies this TaxPar layer, and dissolved into single parcels in this TaxPar layer. Some non-adjacent parcels may be represented by multi-part polygons where they share common ownership and a single tax record. Public right of ways exist as polygons, not null space. Linework associated with private ROWs are retained in the "OthLeg" layer. Water polygons also representing parcel boundaries have been retained in this TaxPar layer. Additional water features that are not considered parcel boundaries may have been placed in the "Misc" layer that accompanies this TaxPar layer. Easements and other similar non-fee taxable boundaries exist in the 'OthLeg" layer, not the TaxPar layer.

attracc.attraccr:
Total number of parcels = 1440 Required match rate where BLDG_VAL or OTHER_VAL > $1000: 99.8 pct Required match rate where BLDG_VAL or OTHER_VAL <= $1000: 97.0 pct
Total number of records in assessor table = 1558 Total records where BLDG_VAL or OTHER_VAL > $1000: 1124 Of these, total records with valid LOC_ID that join to tax parcels: 1124 Match rate for parcels where BLDG_VAL or OTHER_VAL > $1000: 100.0 pct High value match rate passes QA.
Total records where BLDG_VAL or OTHER_VAL < $1000: 434 Of these, total records with valid LOC_ID join to tax parcels: 432 Match rate for parcels where BLDG_VAL or OTHER_VAL <= $1000: 99.5 pct Low value match rate passes QA.
Checking match rate of parcels to assessor list... --------------------------------------------- Required match rate for 1440 parcels: 99.0 pct Total number of parcels with "TAX" or "FEE" POLY_TYPE = 1408 Of these, 1403 join to assessor list. Match rate for "FEE"/"TAX" parcels to assessor table: 99.6 pct Parcel to assessor match rate is ok. Passes QA.

horizpa.horizpar: Data compiled or reviewed for horizontal accuracy ove the MassGIS color orthos from 2008/2009; these orthos are known to be +/- 10' horizontal; however, this data set cannot be used to reach authoritative conclusions about the horizontal accuracy of the boundaries depicted. That work requires a licensed land surveyor.

srcinfo.srccitea: shapefile was created from 100 and 200 scale paper tax maps
srcinfo.srccontr: Source materials current to tax year 2011

procstep.procdesc: Fit existing shapefile onto an orthophoto basemap. Additional information acquired verbally/email from the assessor.

overview.eaover:
For a full description of the features and attributes contained in this data, please refer to the MassGIS Standard for Digital Parcel Files - v2.0.
http://www.mass.gov/mgis/standards.htm#Parstandard

distinfo.custom: Upon compliance with level 3 of the MassGIS Standard for Digital Parcel Files, this data will be made available for download on the MassGIS website: http://www.mass.gov/mgis/parcels.htm

dataIdInfo.idAbs: This parcel layer contains discrete, non-overlapping polygons for each property. Adjacent polygons with common ownership and a single tax record have been retained in the "OthLeg" layer that accompanies this TaxPar layer, and dissolved into single parcels in this TaxPar layer. Some non-adjacent parcels may be represented by multi-part polygons where they share common ownership and a single tax record. Public right of ways exist as polygons, not null space. Linework associated with private ROWs are retained in the "OthLeg" layer. Water polygons also representing parcel boundaries have been retained in this TaxPar layer. Additional water features that are not considered parcel boundaries may have been placed in the "Misc" layer that accompanies this TaxPar layer. Easements and other similar non-fee taxable boundaries exist in the 'OthLeg" layer, not the TaxPar layer. Data updated to include changes as of 01/01/2024.
